newsitem.title: BOLIVIA: SOCCER-LIVID PASSARELLA THREATENS WITHDRAWAL FROM COPA AMERICA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LIVID PASSARELLA THREATENS WITHDRAWAL FROM COPA AMERICA.

text.p: Furious Argentina coach Daniel Passarella threated Tuesday to pull his team out of the Copa America soccer tournament because of a possible last minute venue change for his team's quarter-final match.
Passarella was outraged at an alteration that could force his team to play their quarter-final in La Paz, at 3,600 metres above sea level.
"I'm not going, I'm not going," he said. "This is a complete disgrace."
His outburst came after his team drew 1-1 with Paraguay to finish second in group A.
Originally, the second-placed team in the group had been due to meet the second-placed team in group B in the colonial city of Sucre, which at 2,700 metres high is only 100 metres above Cochabamba.
But the organisers announced Tuesday that the game would be switched to La Paz if Peru or Uruguay won group B.
"We'll see if this is true and then we'll go back to Buenos Aires," he said.
Passarella, who has brought a second-string team to the Copa, is already angry at the timing of the competition, which is crammed between the region's World Cup qualifying matches.
He also said the World Cup qualifying competition itself is too long.
